channel.title: Help making myself owner on my server
channel.description:
ok, im using butterscape client and source, i added custom crowns for mod and admin but i need to no how to add a 3rd one for owner, also i want the player rights be
0 = player 1 = moderator 2 = admin 3 = owner
i changed my rights to 3 but i don't get a crown, how do i fix this so when player rights is 3 i get my custom crown for owner?
hope you understood that...lol, thx in advance. :confused: :confused:

item.title: Help making myself owner on my server
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

nope nothin in it like that at all — AFK 10min[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 28, 2008, 05:47:10 pm[/size][hr]em k, still can’t figure out how to make playerRights 3 have a crown or use my custom crown[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 28, 2008, 05:56:51 pm[/size][hr]em k i think i found teh problem but idk how to fix, it knows that my char belongs in staff and it think playerRights 2 is staff and 3 admin, but i switch it around and it puts me as playerRights 3, but does not show a crown…i still need to know how to add in my custom crown for playerRights 3 and tell it playerRights 3 is staff and it should show a crown…? [br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 28, 2008, 06:38:54 pm[/size][hr]f it, yall arn’t helpin anymore…thx for tryin though…ill figure it out myself…

Read full topic

item.title: Help making myself owner on my server
item.dc:creator: @Rog3r Rog3r
item.description:
@Rog3r wrote:

switch (playerRights) {

Search that, works on Devo v6.

item.title: Help making myself owner on my server
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

client cache? i have in sprites folder for mod and admin, MOD_ICONS 0 <=mod, and MOD_ICONS 1 <= admin, and MOD_ICONS 2 < = owner, mod and admin work fine but can’t seem to get the owner one to work, i added it into class30_sub2_sub1_sub1 just like the mod and admin ones but it still doesnt show up for playerRights 3

Read full topic

item.title: Help making myself owner on my server
item.dc:creator: @Rog3r Rog3r
item.description:
@Rog3r wrote:

Could be that they changed the source’s admin right variable.

Perhaps try 5, if not, you can check the easy way, by searching:

Admin
(Probably won’t work)

Just keep trying those numbers, it’s a horrid way of doing it but hey, it solves your problem.

Read full topic
